ERRORCODE_BAD_CONNECTION_DROP: Server was completely unresponsive and game could not return to the sanctum cleanly.\nPlease try again in a few minutes when the character will have become available to use again.
ERRORCODE_BAD_SPAWN: Failed to spawn in a valid location.\nFor flat portals, please ensure there is adequate space\nto stand up without intersecting the portal.
ERRORCODE_CHARACTER_ACTIVE: Character still connected to a World.\nIf the client was recently disconnected from the server,\nplease try again in a few minutes.
ERRORCODE_CLIENT_TOO_NEW: Client version is newer than expected.
ERRORCODE_CLIENT_TOO_OLD: Client is out of date. Please exit and wait for update.
ERRORCODE_ILLEGAL_PROTOCOL_VERSION: Client version is out of date with the server.\nPlease try restarting Steam to check for client updates.
ERRORCODE_ILLEGAL_PROTOCOL_VERSION_TITLE: Client version is out of date
ERRORCODE_LATENCY_TOO_HIGH: Latency on connection to server is too high.
ERRORCODE_LOGIN_FAILED_TIMEOUT: Connection to game servers timed out during login.
ERRORCODE_NEW_CONNECTION: Started another connection. Are you playing on another computer?
ERRORCODE_NO_REGIONS_ONLINE: Servers are all offline, please try again shortly.
ERRORCODE_PROTOCOL_STREAM_INVALID: Protocol stream invalid.\nPlease try restarting Steam to check for client updates.
ERRORCODE_SERVER_DOWN: Game Server is offline, please try again shortly.
ERRORCODE_SERVER_FULL: No slots available on this Server.
ERRORCODE_STEAM_RUNNING: Game launched without Steam running, please launch game from Steam.
ERRORCODE_STEAM_TICKET: Failed to get Steam session ticket, check connection to Steam.
ERRORCODE_WORLDBUILDER_NO_SERVER: No server is running in World builder.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_ATLAS_DESCRIPTIO: Add a Warp Augment to the Atlas to reveal Beacon locations
Use the Atlas to see where Beacons are located
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_ATLAS_SUMMARY: Looking for your own secluded little corner on a world? Try adding a Warp Augment to an Atlas to display all the Beacons on the world. The lighter regions indicate where a high population of Beacons are and the darker regions indicate a low population of Beacons. You can remove the Warp Augment from the Atlas in the inventory to turn it back into a map.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_COLOUR_DE: Add Gleam to the Beacon Control to set its colour
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_COLOUR_SU: Add a Gleam block to your Beacon Control to set the colour of the Beacon.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_FUEL_GREA: Fuel a Beacon with Greater Beacon Fuel
Add greater beacon fuel to a Beacon Control to fully fuel a Beacon.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_MEMBER_DE: Add a Friend to your Friends list
Use the Beacon Control to assign a Beacon privilege to a Friend
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_MEMBER_SU: Care to share? Sharing Beacon access with friends allows them to interact with and change anything inside your Beacon. Ask friends to help build your base, allow access to Machines or provide Storage and help to reduce the need to Warp. Interact with your Beacon Control and select the Permissions Tab to add a friend from you Friends List. Individual roles can be assigned to each Beacon Member to limit certain privileges.\n\nShare Beacon Privileges with a friend.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_MEMBER_TI: Add A Member To Your Beacon
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BEACON_PRESTIGE_: Add more contents to a single Beacon to boost Prestige:
Place a Beacon on a hostile world
Activate the Beacon with Beacon fuel
Add more contents to a single Beacon to boost Prestige:

Going to a dangerous world and building a Colony is no mean feat but someone has to do it if the Citizens are to expand across the Known Universe. Use your Skills and knowledge to build a base on a dangerous world and expand it to a Settlement for other Citizens to utilise as a safe haven on a hostile world
A Safe Haven On A Hostile World

A furnished Beacon, is a happy Beacon. Take the time to make some home improvements by adding more plots, building, shaping Blocks and storing Items in your Beaconed area. Improving the quality of your base increases its Prestige. The higher the Prestige, the more likely your base is to become a Settlement for other Citizens.\n\nImprove your Beacon Base and increase its Prestige.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_BUILD_NEW_BEACON: Travel to an untouched or developed World and place a Beacon
Add Fuel to activate the Beacon

Citizens are not bound to a single World or Base. Choose to build Beacons in unpopulated Locations or join other Settlements throughout the Known Worlds. More Beacons means more Places to Warp to, making travel throughout the universe a smoother experience. Remember, Beacon Controls must remain fuelled to retain both their protective capabilities and act as a Warp Location. Track Fuel, view Prestige Ratings and select Warp Locations in the Places Menu.\n\nPlace a Beacon on a new World.
Building A Beacon On A New World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CHISEL_DESCRIPTI: Use a Chisel to shape blocks made of Rocks:
Use a Chisel to shape Soil blocks:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CHISEL_SUMMARY: Unleash your structural creativity with a Chisel. When equipped, aim the Chisel at any corner of a Block, then use it to sculpt a new shape. Take heed, not all Chisels are made equal! Different Chisels create different results, and not all can be used on all Blocks. Experiment with various Chisels to add character to your Beacon bases and structures. Chisels can be crafted within a Workbench or purchased from another Citizen.\n\nAcquire and use a Chisel.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CHISEL_TYPES_DES: Use the Stone Chisel to shape blocks
Use the Copper Chisel to shape blocks
Use the Iron Chisel to shape blocks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CHISEL_TYPES_SUM: Unleash your structural creativity with a Chisel. When equipped, aim the Chisel at any corner of a Block, then use it to sculpt a new shape. Take heed, not all Chisels are made equal! Different Chisels create different results, and not all can be used on all Blocks. Experiment with various Chisels to add character to your Beacon bases and structures. Chisels can be crafted within a Workbench or purchased from another Citizen.\n\nAcquire and use a Chisel.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_COAL_BLOCKS_SUMM: Use compacted coal to decorate your Beacon.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CORRUPTION_BLOCK: Corruption type blocks placed in a Beacon:
Use corruption blocks to decorate your beacon. Corruption blocks are mould, growth and ancient corruption and can be found on harder worlds.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CREATE_PORTAL_II: Build a Source Portal to match the Destination Conduit:
Add the Portal Token to set your Destination
Add Fuel and open a Portal

Complete your travel package with a Source Portal Conduit. Two-way travel is available when Portal Conduit Blocks are placed in the same pattern for both Source and Destination Portal Conduits. Source Portals must be fuelled to remain active. A Destination Token must be placed to enable travel.\n\nBuild a Source Portal Conduit and activate a Portal Loop.
Creating A Portal: Part II - The Source
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_CREATE_PORTAL_I_: Take a return trip with a Portal. Providing a two-way travel solution for Citizens, Portal travel is a practical yet complex undertaking. Regular maintenance is required for functional Portal Conduits.\n\nBuild a Destination Portal and lay the foundations for two-way travel.
Creating A Portal: Part I - The Destination

Place a Lock next to Trap Door to configure the lock

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_FOLIAGE_BLOCKS_D: Foliage type blocks placed in a Beacon:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_FOLIAGE_BLOCKS_S: Decorate your build with foliage blocks. Foliage blocks grow on trees and can be waxy, exotic and leafy. You can also find various colours throughout the universe.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_FROST_BLOCKS_DES: Placed Ice block types in a Beacon:
Ice block types chiseled in a Beacon:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_FROST_BLOCKS_SUM: Use ice type blocks to decorate your beacon. Ice blocks can be ice or glacier blocks.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_GARDENING_SUMMAR: Want to bring a bit of peaceful tranquility to your build? Well there's nothing better than having your own garden to relax in. Grab yourself a shovel and dig up some grass seeds and some flowers so you can plant them in your garden. To place grass or flowers simply equip them in your hand and use the item to place the them. To get longer grass simply place another grass seed on top of grass.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_GLASS_BLOCKS_DES: Glass blocks placed in a Beacon:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_GLASS_BLOCKS_SUM: Use glass blocks to decorate your builds.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_GLEAM_BLOCKS_DES: Gleam type blocks placed in a Beacon:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_GLEAM_BLOCKS_SUM: Use gleam blocks to decorate your builds. Gleam blocks can be raw, refined, or lanterns. There are many types of gleam colours which can be found throughout the universe.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_LOCKS_SUMMARY: Need to keep hold of your stash? Craft a Lock and restrict access to Doors, Storage and other interactive Blocks in your Beacon. Locks can be purchased from other Players or crafted with a Workbench, once you have mastered the Common Item Recipes and Common Prop Recipes Skills.\n\nAcquire and place a Lock.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_MASTER_BEACON_DE: Extend your Beacon using a Beacon Plotter
Place a Beacon Control inside a Beacon
Set the Beacon Control as the Master Beacon Control
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_MASTER_BEACON_SU: As you extend and improve your Beacon you may want to change where the centre of the Beacon is located. This can be done by placing a new Beacon Control at the desired location within your existing Beacon. Interact with the new Control and select 'set as Master Beacon Control'. Once set, the location of your Beacon will be updated on the Compass and this will be where you Warp to when setting the Beacon as your Warp Destination. Remember to keep your Beacon Controls Fuelled to keep them active!

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_SETTLEMENT_JOIN_: Discover and enter a nearby Settlement
Use Beacon plots to connect your Beacon to a Settlement

A Settlement is created when a group of Citizens build Beacons near to each other and have enough Prestige to become a Settlement. Other Citizens can join a Settlement at anytime by connecting their Beacon to the Settlement with their plots. You can use the Builder View to see where your plots are in relation to the settlement, making it easier to build the connection.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_BUILDER_STORAGE_BLOCKS_S: Inventory overflowing? Don't leave those Resources behind! Adding storage to your bases lightens your load and allows Resource sharing with Friends. Combine multiple Shelves or Storage Blocks to effectively increase storage capacity. Storage Blocks can be purchased from other Players or crafted once you have achieved the Common Prop Recipe Skill.\n\nCraft or Acquire Storage Blocks to protect and store surplus items.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_AUGMENT_KILLS_DES: Acquire a Weapon upgraded with an Augment
Creatures defeated with an Augmented Weapon:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_AUGMENT_KILLS_SUM: Augments can be used to modify Weapons when they are added to a Weapon in the Inventory. The effects of the Augment will change the performance of a Weapon when it is applied based on the Augment's properties. You can remove an Augment from a Weapon by ejecting the Augment from the Weapon in the inventory.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_ELEMENTAL_KILLS_S: Certain creatures have evolved in a particular way based on their environment. These creatures have been exposed to nearby raw Gem sources and have taken on their elemental properties due to the radiation. Watch out for these creatures as they are known to be more aggressive and dangerous to unassuming Citizens.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_FOCUS_KILLS_SUMMA: The Focus Skill unlocks the ability to build Focus with each attack, up to a maximum of 10, and is a useful Tool for keen combat oriented Citizens. When you have accumulated Focus you can consume a Focus Brew to unleash your Focus Skills in one attack. The effects will depend on the Skills you've unlocked and the amount of Focus you have accumulated.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_HEAL_DESCRIPTION_: Use a Healing Bomb on another Citizen to recover their Health
Use an Energising Bomb on another Citizen to recover their Energy
Use a Cleansing Bomb on another Citizen to remove Debuffs
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_HEAL_SUMMARY: There's no better way to heal nearby Citizen's other than explosive healing powder from Bombs. Equip a Bomb with a healing Augment and throw it at a nearby Citizen to heal them. You can also use different Augments to remove negative status effects, apply positive status effects and recover missing Energy. There are also Bombs that allow you to deal damage to nearby creatures and destroy the terrain.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_METEORITES_COMPLE: These devastating orbs of destruction can cause temporary rifts which allow hostile creatures to enter the world and cause further chaos. Use your Weapons and Skills to defeat the descending horde and break the meteorite to harvest its rewards. The size of the meteorite depends on the number of nearby Citizens.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_METEORITE_HARD_DE: Meteorite creatures defeated on a Ring World:
Meteorite Cores harvested on a Ring World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_METEORITE_HARD_SU: Meteorites are known to fall sporadically throughout the Known Universe, however there are reports of larger and more dangerous meteorites spawning on dangerous worlds. Travel to a dangerous world and see if you can find out more information on these meteorites.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_RAGE_KILLS_SUMMAR: The Rage Skills unlock the ability to build Rage when attacked by a creature, up to a maximum of 10. It uses are extremely powerful for defense oriented Citizens. When you have accumulated Rage you can consume a Rage Brew to unleash your Rage Skills in one attack. The effects will depend on the Skills you've unlocked and the amount of Rage you have accumulated
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_REVIVE_DESCRIPTIO: Acquire a Revive Augment and add it to a Totem
Use the Augmented Totem to Revive a Defeated Citizen
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_REVIVE_SUMMARY: Offer a much needed boost to Defeated Citizens by unlocking your Revive Skill. Once unlocked you can use Revive Augments with your Totem to Revive Defeated Citizens. You'll help them to recover a portion of their Health and Energy, as well as reducing their Defeat Penalty. Continue to upgrade your Revive Skill to reduce the cooldown between uses and improve the effect of the Skill.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_ROADRUNNER_DESCRI: Catch a Roadrunner with a Grapple
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_ROADRUNNER_SUMMAR: Roadrunners are quick and nimble creatures which bolt at the slightest sign of trouble, so a well laid trap is the key to catching these frantic creatures. Try using a grapple Tool to snare the Roadrunner and then finish it off with your Weapon before it can escape.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_COMBAT_WEAPONS_SUMMARY: Predator or prey? Many unique and unusual Creatures roam the Known Worlds, some more dangerous than others. Whether you choose to hunt Creatures for Resources, or fight only when attacked, you will need Weapons. Weapons are highly effective at dealing Damage to Creatures. Once defeated, deal one final blow to the Creature to release its Drops.\n\nAcquire a Slingbow and defeat Creatures.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ADD_FRIEND_DESCRIPT: Interact with a nearby Citizen to view their profile
Add or accept the Friend Request to become friends
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ADD_FRIEND_SUMMARY: When you meet a Citizen you want to continue your adventure with it is always a good idea to add them to your friends list. To add a Citizen to your friends list simply walk up to them and interact with them to view their profile. In the profile screen you can select the option to add them to your friends. Once the Citizen has accepted the invite they will be added to your friends list.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ADVANCED_CONTROLS_D: Use ${ACTION(ITEM_PREVIOUS_NEXT,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ITEM_1,PLAYING)}-${ACTION(ITEM_8,PLAYING)} to swap held items
Hold ${ACTION(QUICK_USE_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to only swap items in the left hand
Use ${ACTION(QUICK_USE_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to only swap items in the right hand
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ADVANCED_CONTROLS_S: Managing your items and quickly swapping between your equipped items is a key element of survival. Citizens have multiple ways they can do this and can choose a method which best suits them. They can use ${ACTION(ITEM_PREVIOUS_NEXT,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ITEM_1,PLAYING)}-${ACTION(ITEM_8,PLAYING)} to cycle items in their hands, they can also hold ${ACTION(QUICK_USE_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} while cycling items to only change items in their left hand, or hold ${ACTION(QUICK_USE_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to cycle items in their right hand.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ATLAS_DESCRIPTION_T: Craft an Atlas with the Workbench
Equip and use the Atlas to permanetly set it to the current world
Use the Atlas to discover a nearby region
Add an Ore to the Atlas to reveal where it is on the world
Use the Atlas to locate and collect the Ore
Place the Furnace Base in a Beaconed area
Place the Furnace Crucible on top of a Furnace Base to build a Furnace
Add a fuel source to the Furnace
Metal bars made with the Furnace:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_ATLAS_SUMMARY: Craft an atlas to see the world and it's Resources.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_BUILD_BASE_DESCRIPT: Storage blocks placed in Beaconed area:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_BUILD_BASE_SUMMARY: You need to build a base.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_CAVE_MINING_DESCRIP: Stone crafted with a Crafting Table:
Set the Warp Conduits to your Beacon
Open the Warp and travel through it to return to your Beacon
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_CHAT_DESCRIPTION_TA: Use /say in the chat window to send a local message
Use /shout in the chat window to send a shout message
Use @ then the Citizen's name to send a private message
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_CHAT_SUMMARY: Chatting with other Citizens is vital for collaboration and social interactions. Press <input> to open the chat window and write your message, then when you are ready press <input> to send your message. You can send messages to nearby players by using the /say command and you can send message to players far away on the same world by using the /shout command. To send a private message to another Citizen enter @ followed by their name and your message.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_CONSUMING_ITEMS_DES: Acquire and consume a Healing Brew to restore Health
Acquire and consume Food to restore Energy
Receive the Well Fed buff by eating plenty of Food
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_CONSUMING_ITEMS_SUM: Use Healing Brews to restore missing Health and consume Food to restore Energy. You lose Health when you take damage and you lose Energy when you perform actions. You'll need to keep a good supply of food to ensure you don't run out of energy. When you have a full Energy bar and consume food you will receive a Well Fed buff which gradually restores your Health over time.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_EMOTES_DESCRIPTION_: Use the emote list to perform an emote
Use /sit in the chat window to perform the emote
Use the quick message list to send a local message
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_EMOTES_SUMMARY: Want to do a dance or send a message to a nearby Citizen but haven't got the time to write it? The best way to do that is to use the emote wheel or the quick message wheel. Press <input> to open the emote wheel and select the emote you wish to use. To send a  Quick Message press <input> to open the quick message wheel and select the message you wish you to send. You can also type the emote you wish to send in the chat message window.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_GATHER_RESOURCES_SU: Unleash your inner Explorer and discover the many Resources scattered throughout the Known Worlds, from the rarest Fragment to the commonest Soil, everything can be put to good use. Tree Trunks and Rocks, for example, are key Ingredients in crafting. Certain Resources, such as Foliage also hold Item Drops which may help to regain missing Health and Energy or be used in certain crafts.\n\nCollect and gather Items.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_GRAPPLE_DESCRIPTION: Distance travelled with a Hookshot Grapple:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_GRAPPLE_SUMMARY: Travelling by the grapple is a really handy way to get around. You can dangle off the edge of a cliff over lava or you can use them to quickly climb up mountains. Simply equip a grapple and fire it to attach to a block then use the ${ACTION(GRAPPLE_BOTH_WIND_IN,PLAYING)} to reel in and ${ACTION(GRAPPLE_BOTH_WIND_OUT,PLAYING)} to reel out. If you want to detach the grapple simply fire it again. There are grapples there attach to a block and allow you to reel in or out and there are other grapples which instantly pull you in, these are called Hookshots.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_HUNTING_DESCRIPTION: Consume cooked food to restore Energy
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_METEORITE_SUMMARY: Find a meteorite falling from the sky, sly the desending horde and harvest your rewards from the meteorite Core.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_RADIAL_MENU_CONTROL: Hold ${ACTION(OPEN_QUICK_USE,PLAYING)} to open the Radial Menu
Use the ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to equip items in left hand radial
Use the ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to equip items in right hand radial

For Citizens who want to quickly swap between Weapons in their equipped slots they can use the Radial Menu to swap items in their left or right hand. Hold ${ACTION(OPEN_QUICK_USE,PLAYING)} to open the Radial Menu then hold the ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to control the left hand or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to control the right hand and move the ${ACTION(GENERAL_LOOKAT,PLAYING)} to select a slot. When you have selected the desired item release the ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to equip the item.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_REVIVE_DESCRIPTION_: Acquire a Revive Augment and add it to a Totem
Use the Augmented Totem to Revive a Defeated Citizen
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_REVIVE_SUMMARY: Offer a much needed boost to Defeated Citizens by unlocking your Revive Skill. Once unlocked you can use Revive Augments with your Totem to Revive Defeated Citizens. You'll help them to recover a portion of their Health and Energy, as well as reducing their Defeat Penalty. Continue to upgrade your Revive Skill to reduce the cooldown between uses and improve the effect of the Skill.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_TORCHES_DESCRIPTION: Equip and place a Torch to light up the area
Equip a Torch at night to provide a light source
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_TORCHES_SUMMARY: Need a light in the dark? Better grab yourself some Sticks and Tallow to make yourself a torch to light up the area around you at night or when you are inside a cave. You can also place a torch to help light up the area around your base or to use them as a way to retrace your steps in a dark cave.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_WARP_DESCRIPTION_TA: Fire the Totem at the location you want to warp to
Set the Warp destination to your new location
Travel through the Warp to a new world
Craft Vital Essence with the Extractor
Craft a Warp Augment with the Compactor
Add the Warp Augment to the Totem
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_WARP_SUMMARY: Prepare to travel to a new world by using a Warp Augment.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CORE_WEAPONS_SUMMARY: Predator or prey? Many unique and unusual Creatures roam the Known Worlds, some more dangerous than others. Whether you choose to hunt Creatures for Resources, or fight only when attacked, you will need Weapons. Weapons are highly effective at dealing Damage to Creatures. Once defeated, deal one final blow to the Creature to release its Drops.\n\nAcquire a Slingbow and defeat Creatures.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_ADVANCED_COIL_DE: Place the Advanced Power Coil next to a matching Machine
Craft an item from a recipe which requires Power
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_ADVANCED_COIL_SU: Too many Power Coils cluttering your home and not enough power to craft what you want? Well an Advanced Power Coil is the solution to your problem. Like an normal Power Coil although more powerful, meaning less Power Coils scattered around your home without reducing your Machine's overall power. Power Coils placed one block away from the Machine will automatically connect to it and increase the Machines power rating.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_A_FORGE_DE: Acquire a Forge with the Workbench
Place and connect the Forge pieces in a Beaconed area
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_A_FORGE_SU: The Forge is a highly Advanced Machine which allows Citizens to customise their Tools and Weapons with unique perks and upgrades. Special ingredients and a certain amount of knowledge is required to complete the Forging process but the rewards can be very beneficial.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_COMPACTOR_: Craft an item in the Compactor

Make your Blocks and Objects tougher than average with a Compactor. By using a powerful compacting process you can create stronger, harder to break Blocks and Objects as well as unlocking amazing new Items to craft. The Compactor is the perfect Machine for discovering new capabilities in the Resources you find.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_CRUCIBLE_D: Place a Furnace Crucible on a Furnace Base to complete a Furnace
Add Fuel to a Furnace to power it
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_CRUCIBLE_S: The Furnace is a Crafting Machine used mainly to smelt ores into bars, to cook food and to craft various other Items which require excessive heat to create. A Furnace is made when a Crucible is placed on top of a Furnace Base. To power the Furnace and generate heat a common fuel source, like Coal, is required.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_CRUCIBLE_T: Building A Crafting Furnace: Part II
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_EXTRACTOR_: Craft an item in the Extractor

There's more to some Blocks than meets the eye! Certain materials contain valuable Resources deep inside them which can only be acquired through a complex extraction process. Acquiring an Extractor Machine will help you to uncover the mysteries of these hidden Resources.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_FURNACE_DE: Equip and place the Furnace Base in a Beaconed area
Place a Furnace Crucible on a Furnace Base to make a Furnace
Add Fuel to a Furnace to power it
Craft an item in the Furnace
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_FURNACE_SU: Feel the heat, build a Furnace. Adding heat to your crafting capabilities opens a whole range of possibilities - cooking food, smelting metal ores and discovering new Recipes. Both a Furnace Base and Furnace Crucible are needed to create a working Furnace. You can use basic fuels like Wood and peaty soil to fuel the Furnace. However, coal is the most efficient fuel but it is not as easy to find.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_REFINERY_D: Craft an item in the Refinery
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_REFINERY_S: Give your Beacons and Settlements a refined feel with some extra shine and polish. A Refinery Machine allows you to give raw materials that extra buff needed to craft more ornate Objects and Items in other Machines.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_SPARK_CORE: Place a Spark Generator in a Beaconed area
Add Fuel to a Spark Generator to generate Spark

Spark, the Crafter's choice. Certain Recipes require something extra to be made efficiently. Get more power from your Machines by generating Spark inside Spark Generators before connecting them to Machines with Spark Links. Spark Generators can be combined to create a Spark Generator Hub, increasing the amount of Spark stored, the result? More power for longer. Spark Generators are crafted in a Workbench or through trade with other Players.\n\nAcquire and place a Spark Generator.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_BUILD_WORKBENCH_: Craft an item in the Workbench

Boost your crafting prowess with a Workbench. Giving you the opportunity to craft with stronger, more durable materials, the Workbench is crafted using Ancient Tech Fragments. Whilst common, these fragments are mainly found deep in mountainous areas and can be tricky to obtain. Remember however, that all Items can be traded for with other Players.\n\nAcquire and connect all four Workbench parts.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_CONNECT_MACHINES: Connect a Machine to a Spark Generator
Craft an item in a Machine which requires Spark

The all new space saving initiative - Spark Link! Connecting multiple Machines to multiple Spark Generator Hubs is costly on space. Optimise room in your Beacons by coupling multiple Crafting Machines to a Spark Generator Hub using Spark Link. To have a successful connection, the Spark Link must be coupled directly to at least one Spark Generator and the Machine.\n\nAcquire and Place a Spark Link.
Connecting Machines To A Spark Generator
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_FORGE_ITEMS_DESC: Acquire a Base ingredient for the Forge
Place the ingredients in the Forge and begin the craft
Use the Resin to complete the Forge process
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_FORGE_ITEMS_SUMM: The Forging process takes place over a number of cycles. Each cycle you can add one of ingredients you assigned at the start of the forge, which can improve the chances of adding a Boon, Perk or Defect to an item you have placed in the Forge. Each cycle reduces the item's condition and when it reaches zero, there is a chance the item will break and be destroyed.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_MACHINE_COIL_DES: Power Coils placed next to a matching Machine:
Craft an item from a recipe which requires Power
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_MACHINE_COIL_SUM: After a Machine has been powered with Spark the next stage in a Machine's evolution is to provide it with Power Coils. The more Coils you have placed one block away from the Machine the higher the power rating. Power Coils will automatically connect to the Machine and improve its power rating, unlocking the ability to craft certain items. Power Coils placed further than one block away will not be connected to the Machine even if they are connected to another Power Coil.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_REPAIR_MACHINE_D: Use a Spanner to repair a Machine
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_REPAIR_MACHINE_S: Give your Machines the once-over. Most Machines gain wear and tear when crafting, without proper maintenance they will eventually break. A Spanner is just the Tool for keeping your Machines in top condition for longer. Equip a Spanner before interacting with a Machine to repair any broken parts.\n\nRepair a Machine.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_CRAFTER_STONE_TOOLS_SUMM: Want to gather faster? Try a sturdier Tool! Stone Tools offer a stronger and faster prospecting experience, allowing the ability to gather previously unbreakable materials.\n\nAcquire a set of Stone Tools.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAILY_LOGINS_SUMMARY: For each day you continue to play Boundless, you will be rewarded with a Daily Activity Bonus. To complete the Feat you must be active for a certain period of time before the daily timer expires.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAILY_XP_EARNED_SUMMARY: Earn the targeted amount of Experience Points before the daily time limit expires to receive a bonus. Experience Points can be earned by performing certain actions or by completing Objectives, Feats and Contracts.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_REDUCED_1_DESCRIP: Total damage reduced from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_REDUCED_2_DESCRIP: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_REDUCED_3_DESCRIP: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_REDUCED_4_DESCRIP: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_REDUCED_5_DESCRIP: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_RESISTED_1_DESCRI: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_RESISTED_2_DESCRI: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_RESISTED_3_DESCRI: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_RESISTED_4_DESCRI: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DAMAGE_RESISTED_5_DESCRI: Total damage resisted from creature attacks
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DEBUFF_OTHERS_1_DESCRIPT: Total Debuffs removed from other Citizens
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DEBUFF_OTHERS_2_DESCRIPT: Total Debuffs removed from other Citizens
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DEBUFF_OTHERS_3_DESCRIPT: Total Debuffs removed from other Citizens
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DEBUFF_OTHERS_4_DESCRIPT: Total Debuffs removed from other Citizens
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_DEBUFF_OTHERS_5_DESCRIPT: Total Debuffs removed from other Citizens
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_ELEMENTAL_WORLD_KILLS_DE: Creatures killed on an elemental world
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_ELEMENTAL_WORLD_KILLS_TI: Creatures Hunted On Tier Elemental World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_ATLAS_DESCRIPTI: Discover a region on an Atlas
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_ATLAS_SUMMARY: Need a map? Craft or find an Atlas and use it to find your way around the world. Equip the Atlas and use it to synchronise the Atlas to that world forever. All your discovered regions will unlock the area on the Atlas for you to see where you are. When you travel to a new world you'll need to acquire a new Atlas and use it on that world to synchronise to it.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_ATMOSPHERE_DESC: Travel to a world with a dangerous atmosphere
Receive atmospheric protection from a Skill or brew
Time in dangerous atmosphere without being defeated:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_ATMOSPHERE_SUMM: Certain worlds will be harmful to unprepared Citizens due to their atmospheres. Travelling Citizens to these worlds will need an Atmosphere Skill or Brew to help them survive or risk defeat. When you find yourself in a harmful world without the necessary Skills or Tools you should Warp home or return to the Sanctum.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_METEORITE_SUMMA: Finding craters with a mysterious rock inside it but no ravenous creatures around? Looks like you may have found a dormant meteorite. These are the remnants of a burning meteorite which recently crashed down on the world and its Core has been drained leaving it vulnerable to passing scavengers. Use your Tools to break through the meteorite Core and uncover its loot.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_REGIONS_DISCOVE: Travel to a Moon type world
Regions discovered on a Moon world:

Moon worlds are challenging worlds with tougher creatures and rarer Resources to find. Spread across these worlds are regions for you to discover. Try using an Atlas to help you discover all the regions on a Moon world.
Travel to a Ring type world
Regions discovered on a Ring world:

Ring worlds are dangerous worlds with harder creatures and very rare Resources to find. Spread across these worlds are regions for you to discover. Try using an Atlas to help you discover all the regions on a Ring world.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_REGION_COMPLETE: Travel to a tier 0 world
Activate an atlas to a tier 0 world
Discovered regions on a tier 0 world:
Use the atlas to discover all the regions on a tier 0 world.
Discover All Regions on Tier 0 World
Travel to a tier 1 world

Discover All Regions on Tier 7 World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_RETURN_TO_SANCT: Set a new destination on the closed Warp Conduit in the sanctum

Stuck between a rock and a hard place? Occasionally, exploring the Known Worlds can leave you trapped in deep caves, stranded in a hole or even lost in the vast wilderness. Choosing 'Return to the sanctum' in the Options Menu can mean the difference between success and Defeat. From the sanctum, either travel through the open Warp to appear close to your previous location, or interact with the closed Warp Conduit to set a different destination.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_SAVE_LOCATIONS_: Add your Location to the Locations List in the Places Menu
Craft a Location Marker from your Locations List

Found a city to explore? An area full of rare Resources? Somewhere you want to return to later? You can choose to add useful areas to your Locations List in the Places Menu, allowing you to easily navigate back there in the future. Feeling generous? Location Markers can be crafted and sold or gifted to another Player, allowing them to track or travel to that Location. To craft a Marker, select a destination from one of your Lists in the Places Menu, and choose Craft Location Marker.\n\nAdd your current Location to your Locations List and Craft a Location Marker.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_SETTLEMENT_DESC: Add a location to your locations list
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_SETTLEMENT_SUMM: Depending on the world there can be a number of Citizen made Settlements for you to discover. A Settlement is made entirely by its Citizens so each one is unique and has different properties. If you wish to save a Settlement's location you can do so by entering the Settlement and choosing to save your Current Location in the Places menu.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_TRAVEL_TO_CAPIT: Travel to the Capital Settlement of your current World

Take a tour of the Capitals, the largest and most prestigious Settlements on each Known World. Capital cities are populated by other Player Citizens who contribute to the area by building shops, houses and unique monuments for others to discover. To find your current Capital, navigate using the yellow symbol on the Compass. Capital cities on other Known Worlds can be seen by pointing your Totem at another World in the sky.\n\nTravel to a Capital Settlement.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_TRAVEL_TO_LANDM: Use the Compass to locate a Settlement and travel to it
Set a Destination for your Home Beacon and travel to it

Navigating is easy with a Compass! To set a Destination, choose a Place from your Locations, Beacons or Settlements Lists in the Places Menu, then select SET AS DESTINATION. Track your Destination on the Compass to navigate back to interesting Places, unusual Creatures and much needed Resources without paying the cost of Warping.\n\nSet a Destination and travel to it.
Setting A Destination On The Compass
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TIER_0_DES: Store a location from a Tier 0 world
Open a Warp to a Tier 0 World
Travel through a Warp to Tier 0 World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TIER_0_SUM: Save a location to a tier 0 world, build a warp using warp conduits and set the destination to the a tier 0 world. Use your Tool to open the warp and travel through it to complet the objective.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TIER_0_TIT: Build A Warp to a Tier 0 World

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TO_BEACON_: Build a Warp Conduit using Warp Conduit Blocks:
Open a Warp to a Beacon in the Warp Conduit
Travel through the Warp to your Beacon

It's good to know that, wherever you are, your Beacon is not far away. Warp Conduits are the key to returning to your Beacon in the blink of an eye. Urgently need a Crafting Machine? Have Items to store? Feeling homesick? Whatever the reason, get back to base quickly by handcrafting and placing Warp Conduit Blocks, interacting with the Warp Conduit, selecting your Home Beacon and clicking Open Warp.\n\nPlace and connect Warp Conduit Blocks, then Warp to your Beacon.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TO_FRIEND_: Add a Friend to your Friends List
Warp Conduit Blocks placed and connected:
Open Warp to your Friend's location
Travel through a Warp to your Friend

A Friend in need is a Friend indeed. Exploring Worlds with your allies is a rewarding way to discover the Universe, especially when you can Warp to each other's aid. To quick visit a Friend, build a Warp Conduit select Open Warp on your chosen Friend in the Warp Conduit Menu, Friends Tab. No one to visit? Find and interact with other Citizens to unlock the 'Add as Friend' option.\n\nOpen a Warp and travel to a Friend's location.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TO_SAME_WO: Add a Location on your current World to your Locations List
Warp Conduit Blocks placed and connected:

Cut down your travel time by adding Worlds, Beacons, Settlements and Locations to your Places Lists. Once added, Places from your Worlds, Beacons, Settlements and Locations Lists can be set as Warp Destinations in the Warp Conduit Menu. No Warp Conduit Blocks? Craft on the go with a few basic materials in the Handcraft Menu.\n\nWarp to a Place which has been added to one of your Places Lists.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TO_WORLD_D: Use an Augmented Totem to set a Warp Destination on another World
Warp Conduit Blocks placed and connected:
Open Warp to a new World
Travel through a Warp to a new World
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WARP_TO_WORLD_S: Branch out and discover new Worlds with Warp Augments. Expand your Warp capabilities by crafting or purchasing Warp Augments from other Players. Combine the Augment with your Totem, aim it at a World in the sky then fire to set your onworld Warp Destination. To travel to your selected destination, build and interact with a Warp Conduit, choose the relevant Warp Destination then select Open Warp. Finally, break the glowing Warp Conduit to reveal the Warp. Remember, greater Warp distances require larger Warp Conduits.\n\nWarp to a new World.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_EXPLORER_WORLD_TRACKING_: Travel to a World you do not have a Beacon on
In the Places menu add the world to your list

When you enter a new world you will have the option to add it to your worlds list. To follow a world you can open the Places menu and in the Worlds selection you can pick the world and add it to your worlds list. You can use the Worlds list to see key information about world and compare it against other worlds.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_ATLAS_DESCRIPTI: Add any Ore to the Atlas to scan for Ores
Use the Atlas to see where Ores are more abundant in the world
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_ATLAS_SUMMARY: Need a Resource? Craft or find an Atlas and add the Resource you are looking for to the Atlas and start scanning the world for it. The Atlases appearance will change to highlight areas where the Resource is more likely to be found. Lighter areas indicate high quantities of the Resources, whereas darker areas indicate where you are less likely to find it. You can remove the Resource from the Atlas by selecting the eject option in the inventory to turn it back into a map. You can also add another Resource to the Atlas to start scanning for a new item.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_BLOCK_COLOURS_S: Not every block is the same! Certain blocks can come in different colours depending on what world they are found on. Travel across the Known Universe and look for blocks of the same type but are different colours. You can use different colours to make interesting structures or use the colour of the block to change the colour of the item you craft.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_BUCKET_SUMMARY: Need to quench your thirst or need water for your recipe? Then grab yourself a bucket and head to the nearest watering hole and start collecting water. Each time you use a bucket near the water source it will collect in your bucket. Use more buckets to collect more buckets of water. You may want to try it on other sources to see what you get. If you find yourself with too much water you can simply empty the bucket in the inventory.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_COAL_&_ORES_SUM: Coal is a valuable fuel source and can be found underground and at any height in the world. There are a variety of Metals Ores like: Copper, Iron, Silver, Gold and Titanium are scattered across the worlds. Some are easier to find than others and are used to craft Advanced items.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_FOSSILS_&_TECH_: Fossils are found deep underground and are used for crafting certain items. Ancient Technology is usually found higher up in the world, typically in mountains, and are commonly used to make Advanced items.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_GATHER_RESOURCE: Unleash your inner Explorer and discover the many Resources scattered throughout the Known Worlds, from the rarest Fragment to the commonest Soil, everything can be put to good use. Tree Trunks and Rocks, for example, are key Ingredients in crafting. Certain Resources, such as Foliage also hold Item Drops which may help to regain missing Health and Energy or be used in certain crafts.\n\nCollect and gather Items.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_GEMS_SUMMARY: The ever rare and supreme gems are a highly sought after Resource scattered across the Known Universe. They are primarily found on dangerous worlds and particularly common on elemental worlds. There are six known Gems in total: Ruby, Topaz, Amethyst, Sapphire, Diamond and Emerald and each one can be found at different depths and locations on a world, so you'll need to use your knowledge and sense of adventure to figure out where they are.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_GLEAM_SUMMARY: Special luminous blocks which are highly sort after by builders who want to liven up their creations. Gleam is a special type of item which can be used to make lanterns and decorative items to brighten up an area or a building. They are scattered throughout the Known Universe and come in various colours.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_GATHERER_SURFACE_RESOURC: There are a number of items on the surface of the world which can be harvested for items including Plants, Rock Formations and Fungi. These items can then be used in numerous crafting recipes to make potent brews, items and other useful objects.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_BUY_FROM_SHOP_DES: Buy an Item from a Shop
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_BUY_FROM_SHOP_SUM: Spend your hard earned Coin at Shop Stands. These interactive Trading platforms are owned and stocked by individual Players. Each Shop Stand carries one type of Item in varying materials. If you are searching for a specific Item, you may need to visit several Shop Stands to find it. Look at a Shop Stand to see what's for sale, interact with the Shop Stand to view which Item variants are available for sale and to make purchases. Move any wanted Items into your Shopping Basket, and choose Make Purchase to spend your Coin.\n\nBuy an Item from a Shop Stand.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_FOOTFALL_DESCRIPT: Collect Coin from your Beacon Control
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_FOOTFALL_SUMMARY: A Coin donation is made to your Beacon Control each time a unique Citizen, who is not a member, visits your Beacon. Try to make your Beacon stand out and become a useful HUB or attraction for other people to visit and in case your Beacon Footfall.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_ITEMS_BOUGHT_DESC: Items purchased with Coin from a red Shop Stand:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_ITEMS_BOUGHT_SUMM: In need of a certain item but can't find it? Head over to a Shop Stand and see if you can find what you are looking for there. You can purchase items from any Shop Stand if it has items for sale. You can see the items for sale by looking at the item on the display or by interacting with it and seeing the list of items it has for sale and how much Coin they are selling for.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_ITEMS_EXCHANGED_D: Items exchanged for Coin to a blue Request Basket:
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_ITEMS_EXCHANGED_S: One Citizen's trash is another Citizen's treasure. When you have items you have no use for, it is worth seeking out an Request Basket which is willing to buy the unwanted items. To see what the Request Basket wants you can look at the item on display or interact with the it and see the list of items it is purchasing and how much Coin it is paying per item.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_PLAYER_TRADING_DE: View another Citizen's profile and select the trade option
Complete a Trade with another Citizen
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_PLAYER_TRADING_SU: One Citizen's trash is another's treasure. What you lack in Resources, another Player Citizen may carry in abundance and vice versa. Try Trading with other Players to obtain the Items and Resources you need, without searching far and wide. To start or accept a Trade, interact with the Player you wish to Trade with. Once both parties have chosen to interact, the Trade Menu will open. Place the Item(s) or Coin you wish to Trade in the available Trade Slot, both Players must confirm the Trade in order to complete it. You can cancel and exit the Trade at any time.\n\nComplete a Trade with another Player.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_RESTOCK_BUYING_BA: When you know what you want but don't have the time to find it, you can set up a Request Basket for other Citizens to see and deliver items for you in exchange for Coin. Placing a Request Stand in your Beacon with an item you want and loading it with Coin will allow other Citizen's sell you the items you want even when you are not around. Remember to come back to collect the items and restock the Request Basket with Coin if you want more.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_RESTOCK_SHOP_DESC: Set the price of the Items
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_RESTOCK_SHOP_SUMM: Too many items and you need room? Or are you an efficient crafter looking to supply the market? Well a Shop Stand is just the thing for you. Setting up a Shop Stand and placing items in it will allow you to items other Citizens once you have set their price. You can only assign items of a similar type per Shop Stand, so if you want to sell different types of items you will need multiple Shop Stands. Remember to come back to your Shop Stands and restock it with more items and collect your Coin earnings.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SELL_TO_BUYING_BA: Trade an Item to a Request Basket for Coin

Turn unwanted Items into Coin! A Request Basket is a Player owned Trading platform which allows you to exchange certain Inventory Items for Coin. View another Player's Request Basket to see which type of Items they are requesting. You can also interact with the Request Basket to see if it is accepting any other Item exchanges in the Price List Menu. Transfer the requested Item(s) from your Inventory into the Request Basket, then complete the transaction to receive Coin. The exchanged Item will no longer appear in your Inventory.\n\nTrade an Item to a Request Basket for Coin.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SET_UP_BUYING_BAS: Place a Request Basket in a Beaconed area
Add an Item to the Request Basket and set your exchange price

Rich on Coin, but poor on Resources? Solve your Item shortage with your own Request Basket and exchange surplus Coin for desirable Items. A Request Basket can be crafted in a Workbench or purchased from another Player. Request Baskets are only active when placed within a Beaconed area. Once placed, configure the Basket to receive the Item or type of Item you wish to receive, then store Coin and set your exchange price.\n\nAcquire and configure a Request Basket.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SET_UP_SHOP_DESCR: Place a Shop Stand in a Beaconed area
Add an Item to the Shop Stand
Set the price of the Item
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SET_UP_SHOP_SUMMA: Whether you choose to craft, gather and collect for profit or simply have surplus Items in your Inventory, creating Shop Stands within your Beaconed areas is a sure-fire way to earn more Coin. Each Shop Stand can sell a single type of Item, though it can sell that Item type in different materials. You will need multiple Shop Stands if you wish to sell multiple Item types. Stocking your Shop Stand is easy, first interact with it, choose an Item to sell, then set the sale price for other Players to see.\n\nAcquire and stock a Shop Stand.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SET_UP_SIGN_DESCR: Place a Sign in a Beaconed area
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRADER_SET_UP_SIGN_SUMMA: It's a sign! Sometimes you just need to shout your message to the Worlds. Leave personal messages for passing Citizens, label your bases and so much more, with Sign Posts. Obtained either through crafting or purchasing, Sign Posts are the simple way to get your message out there. Once placed on the ground, a sign post can be interacted with to tailor its message.\n\nSet up a Sign Post in a Beaconed area.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRUNKS_TIER_0_DESCRIPTIO: Tree Trunks gathered on a Passive world

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRUNKS_TIER_ELEMENTAL_DE: Tree Trunks gathered on a Tier Elemental world
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TRUNKS_TIER_SPECIAL_DESC: Tree Trunks gathered on a Tier Special world
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_BUILD_BEACON_DE: Craft a Beacon Control with the Crafting Table
Craft or acquire a Minor Beacon Fuel
Equip and place the Beacon in the area you wish to claim
Add the Minor Beacon Fuel to activate the Beacon
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_BUILD_BEACON_SU: Your Campfire has served you well, yet its power dwindles. It is time to build a more permanent base using a Beacon Control. But beware, Beacon Controls require fuel to retain their protective capabilities. The decision is yours, secure your current base or move on to a new home?\n\nAcquire and place a Beacon Control.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_BUILD_BEACON_TO: Rocks, the tough alternative to Wood. Found on the side of mountains or underground, Rocks are best released using a Hammer. Trapped? Choose 'RETURN TO THE SANCTUM' in the Options Menu ${ACTION(TOGGLE_MENU,PLAYING)}.

Look at the Crafting Table and press ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}. Select the Recipes tab, then click on a Recipe and choose a craft option. Ingredients are taken first from Crafting Table Storage then your Inventory. Recipes currently crafting appear in the Queue tab until complete.
Offering a more permanent solution to the Campfire, Beacon Controls protect land and placed objects within from other Players and World Regeneration - providing the Beacon remains fuelled.

Beacon Fuel is a crafted Item used to activate and power Beacons. To add Beacon Fuel, look at your Beacon Control and press ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)} to view the Menu, then add your crafted Fuel to a slot in the Fuel tab. If the Beacon expires its contents become vulnerable to other Players and World Regeneration.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_BUILD_CAMPFIRE_: Place the Campfire to set up Camp

Warping your way to a new beginning leaves you open to the dangers of an unknown World. Here, you must claim land to protect your Items both found and made from other Citizens and World Regeneration. A Campfire is an essential, albeit temporary solution to securing your place in this World.\n\nGather materials for building a Campfire, then place it to claim your land.
Strike Trees with your Totem to release and collect Trunks. Use ${ACTION(ITEM_PREVIOUS,PLAYING)} and ${ACTION(ITEM_NEXT,PLAYING)} to cycle between your Equipped Items.
Strike Trees with your Totem to release and collect Foliage. Use ${ACTION(ITEM_PREVIOUS,PLAYING)} and ${ACTION(ITEM_NEXT,PLAYING)} to cycle between your Equipped Items.

Ready to craft? Open the Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)}, select Handcraft then choose a Recipe to Instant Craft; the Item will be added to your Inventory. Uncraftable Recipe? Scavenge for Resources before returning to the Handcraft Menu.

Open the Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)} and assign the Campfire to a hand. When holding the Campfire press ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to place it.

Campfires temporarily claim an area of land and protect Items placed within it from outside dangers. Once burnt out, the contents of the Campfire become vulnerable to other Players and World Regeneration.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_CHARACTER_DESCR: Go to the platform to customise your Citizen
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_COLLECT_TOTEM_A: Collect the Warp Augment from the Plinth
Combining a Totem with a Warp Augment allows a one-shot ability to select a Landing Site on another World.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_CRAFT_TOOLS_DES: Craft or acquire a Wood Axe
Craft or acquire a Wood Hammer
Craft or acquire a Wood Shovel
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_CRAFT_TOOLS_SUM: As your abilities improve, you'll create ever more specialised and sophisticated Tools. Even The Oort started simply.\n\nCraft basic Wood Tools using the Crafting Table.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_CRAFT_TOOLS_TOO: Turn your Trunks into Timber and discover a basic yet versatile Ingredient for crafting Tools, Weapons and other Items.
From the mighty Tree comes the humble Stick. Simple, rustic yet an essential Ingredient for Tool making.

Ready to craft? Open the Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)}, select Handcraft then choose a Recipe to Instant Craft; the Item will be added to your Inventory. Uncraftable Recipe? Scavenge for Resources before returning to the Handcraft Menu.

Ready to craft? Open the Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)}, select Handcraft then choose a Recipe to Instant Craft; the Item will be added to your Inventory. Uncraftable Recipe? Scavenge for Resources before returning to the Handcraft Menu.

Ready to craft? Open the Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)}, select Handcraft then choose a Recipe to Instant Craft; the Item will be added to your Inventory. Uncraftable Recipe? Scavenge for Resources before returning to the Handcraft Menu.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_EXTEND_BEACON_D: Craft a Beacon Plotter in the Crafting Table
Extend your Beacon using a Beacon Plotter
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_EXTEND_BEACON_S: The more you gather, the more you craft, the smaller your Beacon Base seems! It's time for an extension. A Beacon Plotter is just the Tool you need to increase land ownership around your Beacon Base.\n\nCraft a Beacon Plotter and add more land plots
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_EXTEND_BEACON_T: Increase The Size Of Your Beacon
As your level increases, so does the amount of Land Plots you can own. A Beacon Plotter is a crafted device for extending your bases using earned Land Plots.

Upsize your Beacon Base with a Beacon Plotter. Extended Plots can be added next to or on top of your current Beacon Area, highlighted in white. Green highlighted areas indicate where new plots can be placed. You cannot claim land belonging to or reserved by another Player. Need to remodel? Plots can be removed using a Beacon Plot Remover
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_GO_TO_TOTEM_ROO: Use the Light Cube and light your way
Left in the dark? When holding the Light Cube press\n${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to light your way.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_INTERACTIONS_DE: Open the door to embark on your voyage
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_INTERACTIONS_TO: Use ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)} to activate doors and other World Items.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_MAKE_CRAFTING_T: Handcraft a Crafting Table from Timber
Place the Crafting Table near your Campfire
The more you know, the stronger you grow. Increase your crafting potential and discover the art of Machine Crafting with your first Crafting Table.\n\nConstruct a Crafting Table using Timber.
Timber, handcrafted from Tree Trunks, essential for increased crafting power. Sturdy, uncomplicated and the core Ingredient for making a Crafting Table.
Craft more, do more! Crafting Tables are a type of Machine used to make sophisticated Recipes which cannot be handcrafted.
Can't place an Item? Move closer to your Campfire or Beacon with an object equipped. Place the object in a green highlighted area. Red and Orange highlighted areas are not protected by your base.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_OBJECTIVE_COMPL: Complete an Objective in the Journal

With the basics of Known World survival under your belt, it is time to continue your journey, your way. Choose and complete tasks in exchange for rewards, build, hunt, explore, trade or do them all. The choice is yours.\n\nChoose and complete your first Objective.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_RESTORE_ENERGY_: Eat food until you receive the Well Fed buff

As you travel across the world and use your held items you will be exerting Energy. When your Energy is low you will not be able to perform as many actions as you could with Max Energy. Food is an essential source of Max Energy so be sure to consume lots of it to keep your Max Energy topped up. When you consume enough Food you will receive a Well Fed buff which will gradually restore your Health over time.
Consume Food regularly to replenish your Max Energy and avoid low Energy.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_SANCTUM_DESCRIP: Move forward and explore the sanctum
Break the Conduit Blocks with your Totem
Collect the Light Cube from the floor
Collect the Totem and Warp Augment
Combine the Warp Augment with the Totem
Use your Augmented Totem to select a Landing Site
Collect the Warp Conduit Block near the altar
Place the Warp Conduit Block on the Warp Conduit to complete it
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_SANCTUM_SUMMARY: Citizen, join the Great Transmigration! Build new colonies, uncover new Resources and forge travel links across the universe to ensure our survival. A Totem and Light Cube are supplied to help on your journey to uncover the mysteries of the Known Worlds and the Oort who came before.\n\nWalk through the Warp to begin your voyage.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_SANCTUM_TOOLTIP: Look at the Warp Conduit then press ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to break the Conduit Blocks with your Totem.

Warps provide a one-way travel solution for reaching Places in your Locations, Beacons, Friends and Settlements Lists quickly. Once entered, Warps close behind the Citizen. Lost or in a sticky situation? Use the ${ACTION(TOGGLE_MENU,PLAYING)} Menu to return to the sanctum at any time.

Resources, Items and Technologies are abundant throughout the Known Worlds. Most need to be released before collecting. Collect Drops and mined Items by walking up to them; these will appear in your Inventory.
Left in the dark? When holding the Light Cube press\n${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to light your way.
Left in the dark? When holding the Light Cube press \n${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to light your way.
Press ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)} to open the Inventory. Combine the Totem with the Warp Augment.

Orbiting above are the Known Worlds, ready for exploration. Look at the World above you, then hold\n${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to jettison the Warp Augment and set your Landing Site. Warp Augments are one-shot Items, destroyed on impact.

The speedy answer to travelling the Known Worlds. Obtained through craft or trade, Warp Conduit Blocks are used to build Warp Conduits, allowing fast travel to Places added in your Locations, Beacons, Settlements and Friends Lists.

Citizens have the ability to quick equip several objects at once. Open your Inventory ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)}${ACTION(OPEN_INVENTORY_PAD,PLAYING)} and place the Warp Conduit Block in your left hand.
Press ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} to place the Warp Conduit Block.
Your Warp Conduit is complete. Look at the Conduit then press ${ACTION(INTERACT,PLAYING)} to interact with it and activate a Warp to your chosen destination.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_TUTORIAL_SPEND_SKILL_POI: Conquering new challenges reaps rewards. As your level increases you'll receive both new land Plots and Skill Points. Improve and unlock Abilities and Attributes by spending your newly acquired Skill Points in the Skills section of the Character Menu.\n\nUpgrade your Citizen's Skill Set.

Skill Points (SP) are awarded each time you level up. Spend SP in the Skill Menu to upgrade your Citizen. Open the Options Menu ${ACTION(TOGGLE_MENU,PLAYING)} then select Character to access the Skills Menu.

GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_WEEKLY_LOGINS_SUMMARY: For each day you continue to play Boundless in a week, the contribution to your Weekly Activity Bonus increases. To complete the Feat you must travel through one of the Warps in the sanctum and enter a World each day before the weekly timer expires.
GUI_ACHIEVEMENT_WEEKLY_XP_EARNED_SUMMARY: Earn the targeted amount of Experience Points before the weekly time limit expires to receive a bonus. Experience Points can be earned by performing certain actions or by completing Objectives, Feats and Contracts.

GUI_FORGE_COMPLETED_TEXT: Your Gear is setting, which takes some time. You can see its progress in the queue.
GUI_FORGE_FAILED_TEXT: The Centraforge has become unstable causing your Gear to disintegrate. All used ingredients have been lost, unused ingredients are untouched.
GUI_FORGE_RECYCLED_TEXT: The following ingredients have been recovered: ${VALUE}
GUI_FORGE_ROUND_BUTTON_NO_TOOL_SUBTITLE: (Put Forgeable Gear into Forge Item Slot)
GUI_FORGE_ROUND_BUTTON_NO_VIGOR_SUBTITLE: (Not enough Vigour to start next Round)
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_BOONS_DESCRIPTION: Boons are positive Traits added to the piece of Gear being forged. Boon points are built up in the bars next to the Boon Slots before becoming Boons.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_BOON_POINTS_DESCRIPTIO: Some ingredients add Boon Points which fill up the large Boon Bar. If the white slider hits within the filled area of the Bar then the points below the slider get moved into a Boon. The smaller bar next to each Boon shows the progress towards the next level.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_DEFECTS_DESCRIPTION: Defects are negative Traits added to the piece of Gear being forged. Defect points are built up in the bars next to the Defect Slots before becoming Defects.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_DEFECT_POINTS_DESCRIPT: Some ingredients add Defect Points which fill up the large Defect Bar. If the white slider hits within the filled area of the Bar then the points below the slider get moved into a Defect. The smaller bar next to each Defect shows the progress towards the next level.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_INGREDIENTS_MOMENTUM_D: The Effectiveness level of a Centraforge session derives from the Gear's Flexibility (${FLEXIBILITY}), the Machine's Power (${POWER}) and your Intelligence (${INTELLIGENCE}). The higher the Effectiveness the more Boon points are added to create positive Traits. At lower Effectiveness a good outcome is still possible, but higher-level ingredients will be needed. At very low Effectiveness a good outcome is very unlikely.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_MOMENTUM_DESCRIPTION: The Effectiveness level of a Centraforge session derives from the Gear's Flexibility, the Machine's Power and your Intelligence at the time the session was started. The number of Boon points added to make Traits is modified by the Effectiveness.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_QUIRKS_DESCRIPTION: Quirks are negative Traits added to the piece of Gear being forged. Quirk points are built up in the bars next to the Quirk Slots before becoming Quirks.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_QUIRK_POINTS_DESCRIPTI: Some ingredients add Quirk Points which fill up the large Quirk Bar. If the white slider hits within the filled area of the Bar then the points below the slider get moved into a Quirk. The smaller bar next to each Quirk shows the progress towards the next level.
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_STABILITY_DESCRIPTION: Whilst forging a piece of Gear you must keep track of the remaining Stability. Many ingredients have a Stability Cost associated with them, which is taken from Stability when that ingredient is used. If the Stability reaches zero, the Gear and all used ingredients are lost!
GUI_FORGE_TOOLTIP_VIGOUR_DESCRIPTION: Most Ingredients have a Vigour Cost associated with them, which is taken from the Vigour remaining when the Ingredient is used. There are no bad effects from have zero Vigour, apart from not being able to use ingredients that use Vigour. The initial amount of Vigour is determined from your Intelligence attribute when the Centraforge session is started.

GUI_QUIT_TO_SANCTUM_MESSAGE: Quitting and returning to the sanctum in:\n ${TIME}
GUI_REPORT_BEACON_DESCRIPTION: If you see a Beacon or Settlement which is named inappropriately or breaks the rules of Boundless in any other way then please use this form to report it. Move your character into the area of the thing you want to report, or if that's not possible look at it before sending this form.
GUI_REPORT_BEACON_SUB_TEXT: See a beacon name that breaks our rules? Let us know
GUI_REPORT_CHARACTER_PROMPT: Enter the character name to report
GUI_REPORT_COMPLETE_TEXT: Your report has been sent. A representative will review it shortly.
GUI_REPORT_LOCATION_DESCRIPTION: If you see user generated content which is inappropriate or breaks the rules of Boundless then please use this form to report it. You should move your character to look at what you want to report in order to help us find what the issue is.
GUI_REPORT_LOCATION_SUB_TEXT: See a build that breaks our rules? Let us know
GUI_REPORT_NOT_SANCTUM_BUTTON: Unable to report in the Sanctum
GUI_REPORT_OTHER_DESCRIPTION: Spotted a bug or some other issue with your experience with Boundless? Please feel free to use this form to report it.
GUI_REPORT_OTHER_SUB_TEXT: Need to report something else? Let us know
GUI_REPORT_PLAYER_DESCRIPTION: If another player is being abusive, behaving inappropriately or breaking the rules of Boundless in any way then please use this form to make a report.
GUI_REPORT_PLAYER_SUB_TEXT: See a player cheating or harassing others? Let us know
GUI_REPORT_SIGN_DESCRIPTION: If you see a sign which contains inappropriate content then please use this form to report it.
GUI_REPORT_SIGN_SUB_TEXT: Does this sign text break our rules? Let us know
GUI_RESET_SKILL_STARTUP_TEXT_HARD_RESET: In this update all your Skills have been reset and your Skill Points refunded. To reinvest your Skill Points you will need to leave the sanctum.

GUI_SKILLS_AXE_MASTERY_1_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Axe Mastery by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Axe Mastery)} Pt,1)]. Axe Mastery increases your Swing Speed and the amount of Damage you deal when using more Advanced Axes. Basic Tools are not affected by Mastery Skills.
GUI_SKILLS_AXE_MASTERY_2_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Axe Mastery by a further $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Axe Mastery)} Pt,1)].

GUI_SKILLS_BASIC_CRAFTING_RECIPES_DESCRI: Allows you to craft basic Wood and Stone Recipes with a Crafting Table. Interact with a Crafting Table to view its Recipes tab.
GUI_SKILLS_BLOCK_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DESC: Unlocks the ability to craft Compact, Refined and Machined Blocks from Soil, Rock, Coal and Metals.
GUI_SKILLS_BLOCK_CRAFTING_RECIPES_2_DESC: Unlocks the ability to craft Compact and Refined Blocks from Gem and Specials.
GUI_SKILLS_BLOCK_CRAFTING_RECIPES_3_DESC: Unlocks the ability to craft expert Blocks with a Machine. Recipes can be found in a Machine's Recipes tab.
GUI_SKILLS_BOMB_MASTERY_1_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Bomb Mastery by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Bomb Mastery)} Pt,1)]. Bomb Mastery improves your Throwing Speed and the effectiveness of Bomb hits.
GUI_SKILLS_BOMB_MASTERY_2_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Bomb Mastery by a further $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Bomb Mastery)} Pt,1)].
GUI_SKILLS_BOMB_MASTERY_3_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Bomb Mastery by a further $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Bomb Mastery)} Pt,1)].

GUI_SKILLS_BOMB_MASTERY_5_DESCRIPTION: Upgrades Bomb Mastery by a further $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Bomb Mastery)} Pt,1)].
GUI_SKILLS_BREW_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft basic Brew Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_BREW_CRAFTING_RECIPES_2_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft more involved Brew Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_BREW_CRAFTING_RECIPES_3_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft the highest tier of Brew Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_BULK_CRAFT_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to Bulk Craft Recipes in Machines, which allows you to craft multiple Recipes of identical types in the same Queue Slot.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_CHARGE_LANCE_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to perform a Charge Attack with a 'Charger' Lance to deal additional Damage. Hold ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to power up the Lance then release to perform a Charge Attack.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_CHARGE_SLINGBOW_DESCRIPTI: Unlocks the ability to perform higher damage-dealing Charged Attacks with 'Charger' Slingbows. Hold ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to power up a Charger-type Slingbow then release to perform a Charged Attack.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_CREEP_DESCRIPTION: Enables the ability to Creep. It slows your movement speed and prevents you from falling off edges. Press ${ACTION(CREEP,PLAYING)} to Creep.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_JOIN_GUILD_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to join a Clan. Clans are Player-run organisations which work together towards a common goal. Membership is by invitation only.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_MASS_CRAFT_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to Mass Craft Recipes in Machines, allowing you to craft even more Recipes of the same type in the same Queue Slot.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_PLACE_ROTATED_BLOCKS_DESC: Unlocks the ability to place Blocks in different orientations.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_RAPID_FIRE_SLINGBOW_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to Rapid Fire a 'Repeater' Slingbow. Hold ${ACTION(ACTION_LEFT_HAND,PLAYING)} or ${ACTION(ACTION_RIGHT_HAND,PLAYING)} to use Rapid Fire.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_SPRINT_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to Sprint. Press ${ACTION(RUN,PLAYING)} to Sprint.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_USE_PRECISION_BEVEL_CHISE: Unlocks the ability to shape precise bevelled Blocks using a Precision Bevel Chisel.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_USE_PRECISION_SLOPE_CHISE: Unlocks the ability to carve precise sloped Blocks using a Precision Slope Chisel.
GUI_SKILLS_CAN_USE_PRECISION_SQUARE_CHIS: Unlocks the ability to shape Blocks more precisely using a Precision Square Chisel.
GUI_SKILLS_CAUSTIC_ATMOSPHERE_ARMOUR_1_D: **Atmospheres will be part of a future update**

GUI_SKILLS_CHISEL_MASTERY_2_DESCRIPTION: Improves Chisel Mastery by a further $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Chisel Mastery)} Pt,1)], allowing you to Chisel even faster.
GUI_SKILLS_COMPASS_UNLOCK_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the Compass allowing you to locate Citizens, Friends and Places on the same World. Orange tokens show your Beacons, green represents your Friends, pink shows non-friended Players, grey represents Settlements, and yellow shows the World Capital.

GUI_SKILLS_COMPASS_UPGRADE_2_DESCRIPTION: Reveals the locations of nearby Creatures on the Compass.
GUI_SKILLS_COMPASS_UPGRADE_3_DESCRIPTION: Highlights nearby players who need help.

GUI_SKILLS_ENGINE_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DES: Unlocks the ability to craft Power Coils for each Machine type. Placing the correct kind of Coil next to a Machine increases that Machine's Power, particularly useful for crafting certain Recipes. If a Machine's Power is higher than the Power needed to complete a Recipe, that Recipe will craft more quickly.

GUI_SKILLS_ENTITY_INFO_UNLOCK_DESCRIPTIO: Reveals more information about objects, Resources or Creatures when you are facing them.

GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_FAST_1_DESCRIPTION: Temporarily increases your Movement Speed and Action Speed when you consume a Focus Brew. The effects increase proportionally to the amount of Focus accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_FAST_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the effects of Quickening when you consume a Focus Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_SLOW_1_DESCRIPTION: Unleashes an attack which slows nearby Creatures when you consume a Focus Brew. The Range and Effect of the attack increases proportionally to the amount of Focus accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_SLOW_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the effects of Petrify when you consume a Focus Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_STRONG_1_DESCRIPTION: Increases the amount of Damage dealt for a period of time when you consume a Focus Brew, The Damage bonus increases proportionally to the amount of Focus accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_FOCUS_STRONG_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the effects of Precise Strikes when you consume a Focus Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_FOOD_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft basic Food Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_FOOD_CRAFTING_RECIPES_2_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft more involved Food Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_FOOD_CRAFTING_RECIPES_3_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft the highest tier of Food Recipes.
GUI_SKILLS_GAIN_FOCUS_1_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to gain up to 10 Stacks of Focus when you deal Damage to Creatures. Consume a Focus Brew to restore a portion of Energy. The amount of Energy restored is proportional to the amount of Focus accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_GAIN_FOCUS_2_DESCRIPTION: Allows you to gain Focus faster and increases the amount of Energy restored when you consume a Focus Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_GAIN_RAGE_1_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to gain up to 10 Stacks of Rage when you take Damage from Creatures. The effect is applied when you consume a Rage Brew to restore your Health; the amount of Health restored increases proportional to the amount of Rage accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_GAIN_RAGE_2_DESCRIPTION: Allows you to gain Rage faster and increases the amount of Health restored when you consume a Rage Brew.

GUI_SKILLS_PROP_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft useful fixtures and fittings such as Doors, Storage, Signs and Shop Stands, as well as Locks and Torches.
GUI_SKILLS_PROP_CRAFTING_RECIPES_2_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft Advanced Signs, Torches and Lanterns along with Request Baskets.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_ATTACK_1_DESCRIPTION: Unleashes a devastating attack to nearby Creatures when you consume a Rage Brew. The amount of Damage and Attack Range increases proportional to the amount of Rage accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_ATTACK_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the Range and Damage of a Power Surge when you consume a Rage Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_HEAL_1_DESCRIPTION: Restores Health over time when you consume a Rage Brew for a period of time. The amount of Health restored increases with the amount of Rage accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_HEAL_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the effects of Adrenaline Rush when you consume a Rage Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_SHIELD_1_DESCRIPTION: Provides a tempoary Shield when you consume a Rage Brew, increasing your Defence and Resistance against Kinetc and Impulse Attacks. The strength of the Shield increases proportional to the amount of Rage accumulated.
GUI_SKILLS_RAGE_SHIELD_2_DESCRIPTION: Increases the affects of Thick Skin when you consume a Rage Brew.
GUI_SKILLS_REVIVE_1_DESCRIPTION: Unlocks the ability to Revive Defeated Citizens by combining a $[STYLE(Revive Augment,1)] with a $[STYLE(Totem,1)]. The Citizen will be revived with $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Status Effect Resurrection 1 Resurrection Health Proportion,VAL)},1)] Health and $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Status Effect Resurrection 1 Resurrection Stamina Proportion,VAL,ABS)},1)] Stamina and the Defeat Penalty is reduced by $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Status Effect Resurrection 1 Death Penalty Modifier,VAL,ABS)},1)]. It has a Cooldown time of $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Progression Revive 1 Resurrection Cooldown,VAL)},1)].

GUI_SKILLS_STAMINA_REGENERATION_4_DESCRI: Energy regeneration increases by a further $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Progression Stamina Regeneration 4,VAL)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_STAMINA_REGENERATION_5_DESCRI: Energy regeneration increases by a further $[STYLE(${BUNDLE(Progression Stamina Regeneration 5,VAL)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_STEALTH_1_DESCRIPTION: Reduces Creature Aggression range by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Stealth Modifier)},1)]. The choice of the less combative Citizen, Shadow Effect makes unprovoked Creatures less likely to attack you. Some Creatures, particularly on dangerous worlds can be resistant to Shadow Effect.
GUI_SKILLS_STEALTH_2_DESCRIPTION: Reduces Creature Aggression range by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Stealth Modifier)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_STEALTH_3_DESCRIPTION: Reduces Creature Aggression range by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Stealth Modifier)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_STEALTH_4_DESCRIPTION: Reduces Creature Aggression range by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Stealth Modifier)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_STEALTH_5_DESCRIPTION: Reduces Creature Aggression range by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Stealth Modifier)},1)].
GUI_SKILLS_TAX_RATE_REDUCTION_1_DESCRIPT: Reduces the amount of Tax you pay as a Shopkeeper by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Tax Rate Modifier)},1)] when selling items from a Shop Stand or Request Basket. Once activated, revisit any Beacons in which you are selling items to automatically apply the Tax Reduction in that location.
GUI_SKILLS_TAX_RATE_REDUCTION_2_DESCRIPT: Further reduces the amount of Shopkeeper Tax by $[STYLE(${ATTRIBUTE(Tax Rate Modifier)},1)] when selling items. Becomes active when revisiting your Beacons with existing selling platforms.
GUI_SKILLS_TECH_CRAFTING_RECIPES_1_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft Chisels, Spanners and Grapples from Iron, Silver and Gold.
GUI_SKILLS_TECH_CRAFTING_RECIPES_2_DESCR: Unlocks the ability to craft Chisels, Spanners and Grapples from Titanium and Gems.
